overview.title: Mixed Model Line Design (MMLD)
overview.description: The flagship feature of Ezbelta that enables manufacturers to design and optimize production lines for multiple product variants. Unlike traditional single-product line design, MMLD calculates the exact resource requirements when manufacturing different products on the same production line.
problemsList: Guessing at resource requirements based on single products
Using average process times that don't reflect reality
Inability to handle product mix changes
advantagesList: Precise calculations using actual product volumes
Exact resource requirements for mixed production
stepDescriptions: Define your product variants and target volumes
Map the manufacturing flow and process connections
List all processes with their requirements
Set process times and variability for each product
Generate resource requirements and optimization insights

productMix.title: Product Mix Definition
productMix.subtitle: Step 1 of 5 in the MMLD Process
productMix.description: The foundation of MMLD is defining your product portfolio with accurate volume targets. This step determines the demand patterns that drive all downstream calculations.
inputsList: **Part Number**: Unique identifier for each product variant
**Product Description**: Clear description of what this variant represents
**Target Volume**: Expected production quantity over your planning horizon
importanceList: **Demand Accuracy**: Incorrect volumes lead to wrong resource sizing
**Process Loading**: Higher-volume products drive resource requirements
**Mix Sensitivity**: Small changes in mix can have big resource impacts
practicesList: Use realistic volume forecasts, not aspirational targets
Include seasonal variations in your planning
Account for ramp-up periods for new products
Validate volumes with sales and demand planning teams

flowDesign.title: Flow Design & Assembly Connections
flowDesign.subtitle: Step 3 of 5 in the MMLD Process
flowDesign.description: Connect subassembly flows to main assembly processes and define material flow relationships. This step determines how independent flows converge to create the final product.
flowDesign.connectionsDescription: Assembly connections define where and how subassemblies feed into main production flows. They represent the physical convergence points where multiple manufacturing streams combine.
connectionTypes: **Direct Assembly**: Subassembly flows directly into main process
**Staged Assembly**: Subassemblies accumulate before feeding main line
**Just-in-Time**: Subassemblies produced on-demand for main line
considerations: **Synchronization**: Ensure subassembly and main line timing alignment
**Buffer Management**: Size buffers appropriately for flow smoothing
**Quality Control**: Position inspection points at connection interfaces
**Material Flow**: Design physical paths for efficient material movement
practices: Map all material dependencies before designing connections
Consider takt time differences between flows
Design for flexibility in product mix changes
Plan for quality holds and rework scenarios

processList.title: Process List Creation
processList.subtitle: Step 2 of 5 in the MMLD Process
processList.description: Define every manufacturing process in your value stream with proper resource assignments. This step creates the foundation for understanding how your products flow through production.
inputsList: **Process Name**: Clear, descriptive name for each manufacturing step
**Resource Type**: Primary (P), Operator (O), Secondary (S), or IPK Buffer
**Resource Count**: Number of resources required for this process
processList.primaryDescription: Main processing equipment like machines, workstations, or automated systems
processList.operatorDescription: Human resources required to perform manual operations
processList.secondaryDescription: Supporting equipment like tools, fixtures, or testing equipment
processList.ipkDescription: In-Process Kit storage areas between manufacturing steps
practices: Use consistent naming conventions across all processes
Define processes at the appropriate level of detail
Consider both direct and indirect resource requirements
Plan for quality control and inspection points

calculations.title: Line Design Calculations & Results
calculations.subtitle: Step 5 of 5 in the MMLD Process
calculations.description: The culmination of MMLD where your data transforms into actionable resource requirements and optimization insights. This is where the mathematical precision of MMLD delivers tangible business value.
calculations.engineDescription: MMLD performs sophisticated calculations using process-specific demand rather than simple averages. This precision is what makes the system powerful for mixed-model manufacturing.
